title: Venomous snakes stolen from Niagara-area home - National | Globalnews.ca
text:
Listen 
Police in the Niagara Region of southern Ontario are hunting for a number of venomous snakes. 
Niagara Region police say the reptiles were stolen on Saturday evening when a home was broken into in Thorold. 
READ MORE: Brett Eldredge finds a snake inside a toilet 
The stolen snakes include several juvenile cobra species, rattlesnakes, adders and vipers, and a pregnant albino boa. 
The snakes range in size from 12 to 106 centimetres while the non-venomous pregnant boa is 200 centimetres long and weighs about seven kilograms. Thief steals $18K worth of exotic snakes from Nebraska pet store
